title: Integrations Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are seeking a talented and experienced Integrations Specialist to join our small and highly skilled team. Being a part of our team offers you the freedom and trust to take your own initiatives and plan your work accordingly. We believe in empowering our team members to make decisions and take ownership of their projects. This autonomy allows you to explore innovative solutions and contribute to the success of our organization in a meaningful way. You will have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment where your ideas are valued, and you can grow both personally and professionally. You will have the opportunity to work in a company and with a high volume integration platform handling millions of Ecom transactions on a yearly basis, in several countries and across 2 continents.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement complex integration solutions using a Cloud Based Integration Platform (C# based framework)
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze integration requirements.
* Plan, develop, implement and maintain system integrations (For example Ecom/WMS/ERP).
* Document integration processes and provide technical guidance to internal stakeholders.
* As a part of a highly skilled and dedicated team, be involved in improving processes and way of working.
* Be part of ensuring the scalability, stability, long-term development and planning of a modern integration platform.


**What We Want From You**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, people-first environment and is excited to build great stuff. Here’s what will help you succeed:
   

  

* Solid experience in developing and implementing complex integration solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Solid programming skills.


**Nice to have**
* Proficiency in C#.
* Experience working with the cloud-based integrations systems.
* Experience with integrations towards ERP, WMS, and Ecom systems.
* Proficiency with SQL databases.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *Inclusion & Non-Hierarchy* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Customer Solutions Engineer
description:
**Job Title**
 Customer Solutions Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Customer Solutions Engineer,** 
 you will be a key member of the implementation project and service team, servicing and implementing Patient Monitoring solutions at our customer sites. The main goal of your role is to ensure successful implementations and positive customer experiences.
   

  

 The majority of this position is targeted geographically within either Storstockholm/Mälardalen, Lund or Region Västra Götaland, but as a natural part of the service organization, travel outside this main focus area will be required, consequently willingness to travel is necessary for this role.
   

  

**Your role:**
* Install, deploying, servicing and/or integrating patient monitoring hardware and software solutions.
* Configuring, maintaining, and testing our products at customer sites and/or Philips Delivery Center in Upplands Väsby.
* Responsibility for the whole implementation process, from planning through installation, go-live and handover.
* Managing detailed quality documentation in adherence to medical directive standards.


**You're the right fit if you have :**
* Relevant working experience with DICOM, HL7 and Hospital Communication standards
* A minimum of 2-3 years of related working experience with medical devices and understand the special character working in the hospitals is preferable.
* Have a strong interest and affinity for IT solutions including knowledge on networking (CCNA, CCNP, CWNA, CWTS or equivalent) and IT infrastructures (VMWare, Hyper V, SQL Server) is preferable
* Self-motivated, task-forced team player who is persistent in achieving the goals set.
* Highly professional and knowledgeable approach to solving customer problems and ownership of own projects.
* Driver's license (Swedish B) and willingness to travel


**How We Work Together**
 We believe that we are better together than apart.
   

  

 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.
* Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
**Life at UiPath**
 The people at UiPath believe in the transformative power of automation to change how the world works. We’re committed to creating category-leading enterprise software that unleashes that power.
   

  

 To make that happen, we need people who are curious, self-propelled, generous, and genuine. People who love being part of a fast-moving, fast-thinking growth company. And people who care—about each other, about UiPath, and about our larger purpose.
   

  

 Could that be you?
   

  

**Your mission**
 How would you like to help the world’s largest companies transform the way they work via automation, allowing their team members to achieve their full potential? As members of our Enterprise Success team, our Technical Account Managers help our customers achieve more than they ever have by automating the day-to-day and driving business to a higher level.
   

  

 Our UiPath Enterprise Success team advises and guides our most strategic customers in designing and building long-term, enterprise level business automation programs leveraging our people and technology, ensuring our customers achieve maximum business value and organizational impact leveraging the world’s most innovative and proven business automation platform.
   

  

 We entrust our team with UiPath’s largest and most strategic customers, working with stakeholders across all parts of the business and at all levels (C-suite down), to drive business adoption of our capabilities with maniacal focus on achieving tangible business outcomes while enhancing the way their team members work.
   

  

 Our Enterprise Success team is serious about guiding our customers in designing and managing their UiPath business automation platform across the full platform lifecycle, including coaching our customers’ teams on initial deployment, enterprise-wide enablement, and the appropriate methodologies to maximize business outcomes, self-sufficiency, and overall organizational impact.
   

  

**What You'll Do At UiPath**
* Take ownership of your customers' technical success with the UiPath Platform
* Be a core member of the UiPath account team for each of your customers, accountable for technical workstreams that help your customers strategize and execute adoption plans that will return exceptional business value
* Proactively engage and influence your customers, providing embedded technical advisory and guiding the technical maturity of your customers' automation programs to help them achieve their objectives and elevate their line of sight as to what can be achieved
* Provide UiPath Platform infrastructure, installation and upgrade planning, guided assistance, and troubleshooting
* Enable your customers' technical stakeholders on UiPath Platform best practices relevant to their unique automation pipelines, program objectives, environments, and constraints
* Conduct design and code reviews for select automations to reinforce and verify those best practices
* Perform technical health checks of your customers' automation programs and environments, identifying risks and opportunities for continuous improvement across technical disciplines
* Collaborate with UiPath Product Support and other subject matter experts to manage, facilitate, communicate, and bring to positive closure escalated support incidents
* Provide technical advisory to customers through webinars, demos, and speaking engagements
* Develop and mature our teams’ processes, assets, and methodologies in an agile manner to continually iterate and maintain best-in-class delivery


**What You'll Bring To The Team**
* A degree in Computer Science or relevant degree
* A minimum 5 years experience in programming .NET / Java applications (C#, C++, VB, Java or Powershell), SaaS and Cloud experience a benefit
* Fluency in written and spoken English. Finnish is a plus.
* Relevant work experience with progressive responsibility in customer-facing, technical account management or technical consulting roles
* Work experience to credibly communicate with and guide customers on diverse technical topics, including software engineering, packaging and deployment, cloud technologies, and infrastructure engineering
* Previous experience working with UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, Pega or Nice is preferred
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, self-motivated, proactive team player with innovative ideas to inspire customer loyalty and adoption
* Diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through customer issues.
* Willingness to travel for client interactions up to 25% of the time


 Maybe you don’t tick all the boxes above—but still think you’d be great for the job? Go ahead, apply anyway. Please. Because we know that experience comes in all shapes and sizes—and passion can’t be learned.
   

  

 Many of our roles allow for flexibility in when and where work gets done. Depending on the needs of the business and the role, the number of hybrid, office-based, and remote workers will vary from team to team. Applications are assessed on a rolling basis and there is no fixed deadline for this requisition. The application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or may close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.
   

  

 We value a range of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression, national origin, disability, neurodiversity, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes. Additionally, UiPath provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review these and other legal disclosures, visit our privacy policy.

title: Finnish and Swedish Speaking Sales Executive (Enterprise and Public Sector)
description:
Digital Workforce Services Plc is a leading business process automation services and technology solution provider globally. Digital Workforce Outsmart services and technology solution suites allow organizations to save costs, accelerate digitalization, increase revenue, improve customer experience, and gain a competitive advantage. Globally, over 250 large customers use Digital Workforce’s services and technologies to transform their businesses with automation. Founded in 2015, Digital Workforce currently employs over 200 business automation specialists in the US, UK & Ireland, and Northern and Central Europe. Digital Workforce is publicly listed in Nasdaq First North Growth Market Finland.
   

  

 https://digitalworkforce.com
   

  

 We are a well-established leader in the field of Business Process Automation (BPA) and Robotic Process Automation (RPA). Our success is not solely defined by our impressive revenue and growth but by the profound trust, our customers have in our services.
   

  

 With over 250 global clients, our dedication to meeting their unique needs is our compass. Our clients, primarily within the healthcare sector, regard us as a key partner in their digital transformation journey. We thrive on this trust, which has been earned through our relentless pursuit of excellence, our innovative approach, and our deep understanding of their businesses. Join our team, where your passion for building connections fuels our collective success.
   

  

**Currently We Are Looking For**
**FINNISH AND SWEDISH SPEAKING SALES EXECUTIVE (Enterprise and Public sector)**
 As a Sales Executive specializing in the Nordic Enterprise and Public market you will drive our growth and profitability by acquiring new clients in combination with managing opportunities at existing accounts.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Consultative Sales: Work closely with prospects and our internal teams to understand the customer challenges and objectives. Present comprehensive offerings that effectively address these needs and demonstrate clear value propositions aligned with the customer’s strategic goals.
* Lead Sales Cycles: Take ownership of the entire sales process, from initial contact through to contract closure. Effectively manage relationships and expectations while ensuring alignment between customer requirements and our capabilities.
* Prospect and Acquire New Clients: You will actively seek out and engage with new prospects. Your goal is to build a robust pipeline of potential clients and convert them into long-term partners.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with internal teams, including customer success managers, operations managers, and analysts, to deliver comprehensive solutions that exceed client expectations.


**Your Impact**
 Your efforts will directly contribute to our mission of enhancing business processes through innovative automation solutions. By expanding our client base and fostering new relationships, you will play a pivotal role in improving our clients’ customer journeys and operational efficiency, while reducing their costs.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 ✅ Opportunity to influence our customers’ businesses through automation and AI
   

  

 ✅ Interesting work environment with an international twist
   

  

 ✅ Great benefits package and company culture, where caring for each other is key
   

  

 ✅ Encouraging attitude towards learning mindset and self-development: taking part in seminars, events, courses, knowledge sharing
   

  

 ✅ Possibility to work remotely within country of employment- Sweden or Finland
   

  

**We might be looking for you, if you match these criteria**
 Proven Sales Experience – A strong track record in B2B IT services sales, preferably in automation market and towards the FSI, Retail or Manufacturing sectors, but it is not just sales that matters, but foremost creating a real value for our customers and building long term relationships
   

  

 Excellent Communication skills – Strong negotiation, presentation, and interpersonal skills to engage and influence
   

  

 Self-Motivated & Independent – You thrive in an autonomous role with a high level of ownership and responsibility.
   

  

 Team Player – You Work effectively with internal teams, including customer success, operations, and marketing, to drive success
   

  

 Industry Knowledge – Strong experience with business process automation and relevant market leading solutions is an advantage
   

  

 We will highly value a proven track record of delivering successful business growth with the Microsoft ecosystem
   

  

 You speak fluently English, Swedish and Finnish (other Nordic languages are considered a plus)
   

  

 Join us in re-defining work and business operations through automation technology. If you're passionate about sales, driven by results, and eager to make a difference, we invite you to apply.
   

  

 Apply with your CV or link to LinkedIn by the
 **3rd of March 2025** 
 . Please note that we will start interviews as soon as potential candidates are identified and may close the job post earlier.

title: Senior Functional Safety Engineer
description:
About the Role
  
As a Senior Functional Safety Engineer, you will be part of our central Functional Safety Competence Center, contributing to both process and product development. Your work will span all levels of product development, from strategic planning to supplier selection, functional safety reviews, concept design, and product launch. This role at customer site involves close collaboration with electrical and mechatronics engineers, customers, suppliers, and technical partners.
  
You will focus on safety design, requirement reviews, and guiding teams through Functional Safety Concept (FSC) and Technical Safety Concept (TSC) implementation at system, software, and hardware levels.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Develop and implement functional safety guidelines and provide structured templates.
  
Conduct functional safety training for impact analysis, HARA, safety analysis (SW & HW).
  
Plan and oversee safety test activities (Safety Plan) tailored to specific vehicle projects.
  
Drive functional and technical safety concept development at function, system, software, and hardware levels.
  
Lead functional safety engineering activities and develop technical work products.
  
Perform impact analyses and define safety criteria in system design.
  
Ensure the correct implementation of functional and technical safety requirements across vehicle systems.
  
Develop safety verification and validation strategies (HARA, FTAs, FMEAs, safety concepts).
  
Integrate ISO 26262 Functional Safety standards into corporate processes.
  
Align safety requirements with suppliers and customers to ensure compliance and efficiency.
  
Ensure proper documentation management and that safety activities meet project timelines.
  
  

Who You Are
  
You are a technically skilled, collaborative, and motivated leader with a strong belief in agile methodologies. You thrive in cross-functional environments and have a passion for developing and inspiring teams.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

✔ M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Electrical, Applied Physics, or Mechatronics Engineering
  
✔ Extensive knowledge of ISO 26262 functional safety activities and processes
  
  

**✔ Proven experience in:**  

HW/SW safety analysis, including FMEA & FTA
  
Freedom from interference (DFA) analysis
  
Hardware-software interface (HSI) specification
  
HW/SW architecture, schematics, BOM list, and ASIL C/D metrics
  
Functional & technical safety concept development (ASIL domains)
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
At Dizayee Solutions AB, we offer an opportunity to work on cutting-edge automotive safety projects, collaborate with leading experts, and drive innovation in functional safety. If you’re looking for a dynamic and impactful role, this is the place for you!
  
Apply Now!
  
Interested candidates can send their CV to info@dsab.eu or reach out for more details. This is a consultant role, selected candidate will work with automotive company and follow customers rules and regulations.

title: Frontend Engineer - React & React Native
description:
Since our inception in 2017, Anyfin has empowered thousands across Sweden, Finland, Germany, and Norway to manage their finances better, saving millions through smart refinancing options. We’re growing rapidly and have big ambitions on the horizon, with new markets to explore and impactful products to launch. To fuel our mission, we’re seeking a dedicated and talented Frontend Engineer who’s ready to create seamless and innovative digital experiences for our users across web and mobile platforms.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Frontend Engineer at Anyfin, you’ll play an essential role in building and enhancing our user-facing applications, ensuring they are intuitive, performant, and visually stunning. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver world-class solutions across web and mobile platforms. Here’s how you’ll contribute:
   

  

* Feature Development: Design, develop, and maintain features across our web and mobile platforms using React and React Native. Build reusable components and front-end libraries that promote scalability and efficiency. Contribute to our mobile app’s development using React Native, ensuring smooth functionality and aesthetic appeal on both iOS and Android.
* UI Implementation: Collaborate closely with our design team to bring pixel-perfect UIs to life, utilizing styled-components for visual consistency and Storybook for efficient component management.
* API Integration: Integrate with our GraphQL API, ensuring that data is managed seamlessly within the app, fostering efficient client-server interactions that keep our app performing at its best.
* Code Quality & Type Safety: Write well-structured, maintainable code with a strong focus on TypeScript for clarity and type safety, promoting a clean codebase and scalable solutions across the development lifecycle.
* Experimentation & Growth: Partner with our product team to implement and track features through Growth Book experiments, helping optimize user engagement and continuously improving our mobile experience.
* Testing & QA: Develop and maintain automated end-to-end tests to ensure stability and high-quality code delivery, allowing us to release with confidence and reliability.


**Who You Are**
 You have a passion for frontend development and have worked with React and TypeScript, either professionally or through personal projects. You’re eager to learn and contribute to building highly interactive web applications. While experience with React Native is a bonus, your willingness to grow into this area is what counts most. You value writing clean and maintainable code and enjoy collaborating with designers and other engineers to bring ideas to life. You’re curious about working with APIs, experimenting with new ideas, and ensuring a great user experience through testing and iteration. Most importantly, you thrive in a supportive team environment where learning and growth are celebrated.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

***Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.***
 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to reduce the costs of high-interest loans, get a detailed overview of their fixed costs, and see their credit score.

title: QA Automation Engineer IRC250572
description:
**Description:**
 We are looking for a QA Automation Engineer for an onsite position in Stockholm, Sweden. This role offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, combining automation expertise with hands-on hardware testing, while collaborating closely with engineering teams to enhance product quality and performance.
   

  

**Requirements:**
**Main Requirements:**
* Experience with Automation: Proficiency in automation frameworks (Java, Python).
* Hands-on Hardware Experience: Practical experience with hardware testing, particularly related to navigation systems in vehicles.
* Communication Skills: Strong ability to liaise between teams and gather feedback from engineers.
* Driving Requirements: Should be able to drive a truck as a passenger and collect navigation data on the road. A truck driver’s license is a plus.
* Senior-Level Expertise: Proven experience in setting up QA frameworks, particularly in automation, and working in a cross-functional engineering environment.


**Preferences:**
**Job Responsibilities:**
* Setting Up Processes & Frameworks: Design, implement, and optimize QA processes and automation frameworks, focusing on Java and Python.
* Hardware Testing: Conduct hands-on testing of navigation systems in real-world driving scenarios (on-site in Stockholm or near Södertälje).
* Navigation Data Collection: Test a truck during driving to collect navigation data, ensuring accurate logs and feedback from on-road tests.
* Collaboration with Engineering Teams: Communicate effectively with engineers to gather and analyze feedback, ensuring continuous improvement of products.
* Automation Development: Contribute to the transition from manual to automated testing by developing, maintaining, and improving automated test scripts and frameworks.


**What We Offer**
**Empowering Projects:** 
 With 500+ clients spanning diverse industries and domains, we provide an exciting opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking projects that leverage cutting-edge technologies. As a team, we engineer digital products that positively impact people’s lives.
   

  

**Empowering Growth:** 
 We foster a culture of continuous learning and professional development. Our dedication is to provide timely and comprehensive assistance for every consultant through our dedicated Learning & Development team, ensuring their continuous growth and success.
   

  

**DE&I Matters:** 
 At GlobalLogic, we deeply value and embrace
 **diversity** 
 . We are dedicated to providing
 **equal** 
 opportunities for all individuals, fostering an
 **inclusive** 
 and empowering work environment.
   

  

**Career Development:** 
 Our corporate culture places a strong emphasis on career development, offering abundant opportunities for growth. Regular interactions with our teams ensure their engagement, motivation, and recognition. We empower our team members to pursue their career goals with confidence and enthusiasm.
   

  

**Comprehensive Benefits:** 
 In addition to equitable compensation, we provide a comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes the overall well-being of our consultants. We genuinely care about their health and strive to create a positive work environment.
   

  

**Flexible Opportunities:** 
 At GlobalLogic, we prioritize work-life balance by offering flexible opportunities tailored to your lifestyle. Explore relocation and rotation options for diverse cultural and professional experiences in different countries with our company.
   

  

**About GlobalLogic** 
 GlobalLogic is a leader in digital engineering. We help brands across the globe design and build innovative products, platforms, and digital experiences for the modern world. By integrating experience design, complex engineering, and data expertise—we help our clients imagine what’s possible, and accelerate their transition into tomorrow’s digital businesses. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic operates design studios and engineering centers around the world, extending our deep expertise to customers in the automotive, communications, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, manufacturing, media and entertainment, semiconductor, and technology industries. GlobalLogic is a Hitachi Group Company operating under Hitachi, Ltd. (TSE: 6501) which contributes to a sustainable society with a higher quality of life by driving innovation through data and technology as the Social Innovation Business.

title: Senior Testare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Analysera systemkrav för att säkerställa korrekthet och testbarhet.
* Skapa detaljerade testspecifikationer och testplaner.
* Utföra manuell testning
* Dokumentera och kommunicera avvikelser på ett tydligt sätt för att driva förbättringar.
* Prioritera och hantera testfall baserat på risk och komplexitet.
* Genomföra acceptanstester


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning krävs för att snabbt kunna bidra till gruppens arbete och säkerställa hög kvalitet i våra leveranser
* Relevant IT-utbildning, kandidatexamen inom naturvetenskap/teknik/teknik, inom datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande
* God kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift i både på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i JIRA och Confluence
* Erfarenhet av Doors


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 31-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Open application for Senior Game Designers
description:
**Your Mission**
 As a
 **Senior Game Designer,** 
 you will be responsible for designing game systems and features with the Game Director. You will write and help keep the design documentation up to date. Together with your team members, you will play a vital role in creating and implementing creative contributions according to the design
   

  

 As a creative force at Paradox, you are expected to have a genuine passion for Grand Strategy Games and a good understanding of what makes them so appealing to our players. If you want to be an important part of shaping the next generation of strategy games, don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* We believe that you have a solid understanding of strategy games and have experience with designing complex game systems.
* Strong communicator and team player, as you will have a direct and influential impact on the quality and feel of the game.


**Work Culture**
 We are dedicated to crafting thought-provoking games that our players adore and are eager to enjoy endlessly. Every member of the Paradox team is committed to contributing their best and sharing the drive to achieve our goals, reaching new pinnacles as a united force. Creativity, autonomy, and self-initiation are the building blocks of our game development process, all made feasible by a substantial foundation of trust. We are establishing this trust-based environment by having faith in our colleagues to act with the best of intentions.
   

  

 Our culture evolves through our engagements with our players and our deep understanding of their desires and expectations. We're dedicated to comprehending our players and what they truly cherish in our games, as well as their mindset while enjoying them.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full-time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Design Director
   

  

 Location: This position is based in Sweden, Stockholm
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Embeddedutvecklare C
description:
Är du vår nästa kollega? Produktutvecklingsgruppen Animal Intelligence and Milking Points på DeLaval expanderar och vi letar efter en skicklig Embeddedutvecklare som har lång erfarenhet inom C och hårdvarunära programmering. Vi är 15 stycken Embeddedutvecklare och Elektronikkontruktörer som ansvarar för hela livscykeln för en produktfamilj. Just nu är vi i en expansiv fas med mycket nyutveckling!
   

  

**Din roll och ansvarsområden**
 Som Embeddedutvecklare blir du en viktig del av verksamheten där du bidrar med din goda kompetens inom inbyggda system. Du kommer att delta i våra olika utvecklingsprojekt och utveckla arkitektur och mjukvara tillsammans med elektronikdesigners från start till mål. Hos oss får du tillgång till ett fantastiskt utvecklande arbete med bra teknikhöjd och långsiktiga lösningar. Vi har en komplett digitaliserad arbetsmiljö där arbetsuppgifter, projekttavlor, planering, och uppföljning sker digitalt. Vi arbetar i inkrement om 10 veckor och sprintar på två veckor.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag blir att utveckla DeLavals nya generation modulära enheter för mjölkning. Produkternas miljö- och kvalitetskrav är mycket höga och alla produkter säljs över hela världen i enlighet med efterföljande regelverk.
   

  

**Utvecklingsmiljö Och Verktyg**
* Ubuntu (just nu 18) som utv. datorer.
* git och gitlab in-house, Jira, Confluence och Microsoft 360.
* Kompilator är gcc för arm med SoC libbar från leverantörerna.
* Byggsystem/dependencies är gjort med Scones (ej förkunskapskrav).
* Google test för unit-tester.
* Utveckling sker med hjälp av JTAG och SWD på skrivbordet.
* Kvaser LIN donglar för att lyssna på trafiken.
* Debug och omvärldsemulering sker med serie/DCL.
* Blåtand används också för setup av tester.
* Vissa meddelanden och tester sker via testgränsnitt i TCP/IP.


 Allt det här sköts av vårt testramverk i Python som används vid utveckling på skrivbordet.
   

  

 Samma testramverk används även i de automatiska testerna av applikationerna, ett första integrationstest och sköts av Jenkins-jobb.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För Att Vara Framgångsrik i Denna Roll Tror Vi Att Du Är Engagerad Och Drivande. Du Är Anpassbar Och Har En Positiv Attityd Samt Är Trygg i Din Kompetens. Övriga Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Minimum fem års arbetslivserfarenhet av hårdvarunära mjukvaruutveckling i C från medelstora och/eller stora företag.
* Erfarenhet av C++ och gärna Python.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt.
* Grundläggande elektronikkunskap (att kunna läsa ett schema t.ex.).
* Erfarenhet av GIT.
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska.


**Vi erbjuder**
 Våra kärnvärden Passion, People, Professionals och Partnerskap kopplar samman individer över enheter och geografiska områden. Framgång är mycket mer än kunskap – det är starkt relaterat till beteende. På DeLaval styrs vi alla av våra tre beteenden: Ange riktning, Få saker att hända och One DeLaval.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats utan dess like, där den senaste tekniken går hand i hand med djurens välbefinnande. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval Group tillsammans med Tetra Pak och Sidel.
   

  

**Dessutom Erbjuder Vi**
* En trygg anställning och förmåner från kollektivavtalet (tjänstepension, arbetsrelaterad olycksfallsförsäkring, arbetstidsförkortning).
* Föräldraledighetsersättning (ca 10 procent av den anställdes månadslön).
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr/år.
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring.
* Flexibla arbetstider.
* 30 dagars betald semester per år.


**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är på heltid och placerad på DeLavals huvudkontor i vår idylliska omgivning i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Arbetet utförs delvis på distans men majoriteten av din arbetstid utförs på kontoret.
   

  

 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att ansöka. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post, men har du frågor om rekryteringen eller tjänsten är du välkommen att höra av dig.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Rekryterande chef: Pontus Häger, pontus.hager@delaval.com
   

  

 HRBP: Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com
   

  

 Rekryterare: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**Om DeLaval**
 Vår vision är att göra hållbar livsmedelsproduktion möjlig. Som ett företag byggt på innovation arbetar vi ständigt med att hitta sätt att hjälpa våra kunder, mjölkbönder, att göra mer med mindre genom att tillhandahålla världsledande mjölkningsutrustning och lösningar.
   

  

 Idag har DeLaval cirka 4 500 passionerade yrkesverksamma på mer än 100 marknader runt om i världen. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval Group. Se mer på https://corporate.delaval.com/
